text: The only way to do great work is to love what you do.
author: Steve Jobs

text: Code is like humor. When you have to explain it, it's bad.
author: Cory House

text: The universe is not only queerer than we suppose, but queerer than we can suppose.
author: J.B.S. Haldane

text: Any sufficiently advanced technology is indistinguishable from magic.
author: Arthur C. Clarke

text: First, solve the problem. Then, write the code.
author: John Johnson

text: The cosmos is within us. We are made of star-stuff.
author: Carl Sagan

text: Simplicity is the soul of efficiency.
author: Austin Freeman

text: The science of today is the technology of tomorrow.
author: Edward Teller

text: In the middle of difficulty lies opportunity.
author: Albert Einstein

text: The best way to predict the future is to create it.
author: Peter Drucker

text: Look up at the stars and not down at your feet.
author: Stephen Hawking

text: Every great developer you know got there by solving problems they were unqualified to solve.
author: Patrick McKenzie

text: You have to be odd to be number one.
author: Dr. Seuss

text: I'm not lazy, I'm on energy-saving mode.
author: Anonymous

text: It works on my machine.
author: Every Developer Ever

text: I have not failed. I've just found 10,000 ways that won't work.
author: Thomas Edison

text: Why fit in when you were born to stand out?
author: Dr. Seuss

text: The trouble with programmers is that you can never tell what they're doing until it's too late.
author: Seymour Cray

text: Normal is boring. Embrace your weird.
author: Anonymous

text: Reality is merely an illusion, albeit a very persistent one.
author: Albert Einstein

text: Be yourself; everyone else is already taken.
author: Oscar Wilde

text: I put the 'Pro' in procrastination.
author: Anonymous
